author: Emma Powell
title: Kanye West deletes all Donald Trump posts from his Twitter account

locations.name: trump tower drew angerer/getty images  kanye west

text:
Kanye West deletes all Donald Trump posts from his Twitter account 
West is said to be unhapy with Mr Trump's US travel ban Tuesday 7 February 2017 07:56 BST Click to follow 
Kanye West has deleted all of his Donald Trump posts from his Twitter account. 
The US rapper, 39, removed all trace of the President from his page just weeks after appearing to throw his support behind the Republican. 
In December, West – who told fans he would have voted for Mr Trump – met with the then-President elect at Trump Towers in New York City to discuss “issues including bullying, supporting teachers, modernising curriculums, and violence in Chicago”. 
After posing together for photographers West later tweeted: “I wanted to meet with Trump today to discuss multicultural issues. Kanye West meets with President-elect Donald Trump at Trump Tower 
“I feel it is important to have a direct line of communication with our future president if we truly want change.” 
The message read: “To Kanye, you are a great friend, thanks, Donald Trump.” Read more Kanye West not ‘traditionally American enough’ to sing at inauguration 
West’s followers slammed him for the post and urged him to delete his social media accounts. 
US site TMZ reported that West removed all trace of the President from his account after he implemented a travel ban on refugees and people from Muslim-majority countries entering the US. 
Standard Online has contacted a representative for West for comment. Kanye West meets Donald Trump - In pictures Kanye West meets Donald Trump - In pictures 1/6 
U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and musician Kanye West pose for media at Trump Tower in Manhattan Andrew Kelly/Reuters 2/6 
President-elect Donald Trump and Kanye West stand together in the lobby at Trump Tower in New York Drew Angerer/Getty Images 3/6 
Singer Kanye West and President-elect Donald Trump leave the elevator after their meeting at Trump Tower Timothy A.Clary/AFP/Getty Images 4/6 
Singer Kanye West and President-elect Donald Trump arrive to speak with the press after their meetings at Trump Towe Timothy A.Clary/AFP/Getty Images 
President-elect Donald Trump pats Kanye West on the back in the lobby at Trump Tower Drew Angerer/Getty Images 
Kanye West arrives at Trump Tower in Manhattan Jihn Taggart/EPA
